page.title: 15Industry in Knowle Green
page.content:
Mini-prints at Knowle Green was founded ten years ago by its two directors who found themselves made redundant in the economic recession. They bought an old Bobbin Mill of some antiquity, situated on the banks of a fast-flowing stream and since then, modern administration offices have been built.
The firm specialises in the reduction of photographs used, for example, in the advertising of houses by estate agents and now has subsidiary companies in Canada and South Africa and has recently opened laboratories in Darlington. Mini-prints employ some 60 people, mostly local whom it transports to and from work due to the lack of suitable buses and it has 4 or 5 teenaged persons on the Youth Training Scheme.
